results.title: Helicopter Canada
results.creator_credit: Eugene Boyko, Peter Jones, Tom Daly, National Film Board of Canada, Derek May and Donald Brittain
results.brief_description: A helicopter was used throughout this exploration of the ten provinces. The result of this off-the-ground portraiture is a view that is big, beautiful, and continuously engrossing. Nothing here is quite the same as seen before, even Niagara Falls. Canadians will be thrilled by this Panavision view of familiar territory. The ‘Beatles’ appear briefly in a limousine. Made for international distribution for the Canadian centennial. Written by Donald Brittain and Derek May. Narrated by Stanley Jackson. Edited by Rex Tasker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eugene Boyko, Peter Jones, Tom Daly, National Film Board of Canada, Derek May and Donald Brittain

results.title: Flags = Zastave
results.creator_credit: Zoran Jovanovic, Nancy Karkowsky and Neoplanta Film
results.brief_description: Zoran Jovanovic, in simple line drawings, explores man’s complex relationship to one of his most important symbols - the flag. Only women, Jovanovic implies, see the flag not as symbol but as fabric. Animation by Predrag Pantovic and Slavomir Calic.

results.title: Drying
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Preservign and Drying of Plant Material”.
One of three films dealing with different aspects of preserving and drying of plant material, showing the techniques and everyday domestic equipment needed to achieve satisfactory results. This film deals with preservation by drying.

results.title: [Melbourne newsreel: 1925]
results.brief_description: A newsreel of Melbourne in 1925 containing scenes of Empire Day celebrations at Princes Hill State School, Carlton; the opening of the Melbourne Track Season; a three-mile handicap race at Caulfield Racecourse by the Combined Harriers; and long-distance running. Re-released in 1947 by the National Film Archive.

results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 288 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mirror of Germany. The German Scene = Deutschland Spiegel”.
Magazine items: Football, West Germany vs. Argentina Juniors; Camping sites, coutry areas, boating highlights 1978; Helmut Schmidt, International leaders meeting; Improvement and emergence of new political city of Bonn; Recycling of cars every 20 seconds and crush 1000 cars per day; Peruvian artefacts in new museum in Berlin with department for the blind and a children’s wing, hands on and educational unit; Horse breeding and riding popular only 20 percent of stud released for breeding per year.

results.title: Colombia and Venezuela
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Among the most advanced on the continent, these Caribbean countries still suffer from the ills that continue to plague all of Latin America. One crop economics, a population explosion and unequal land distribution are certainly negative influences but real changes are being made as the economy continues to expand and diversify.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William L. Claiborne and Sterling Educational Films
results.description: Among the most advanced on the continent, these Caribbean countries still suffer from the ills that continue to plague all of Latin America. results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 134
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Farmers cannot often make hay while the sun shines, and the hayfields themselves can often become junior jungles - new machinery has the answer to this problem; anthracite coal is converted into “active carbon” whose particles have a vast porous surface - they literally “hang on” to any impurities in water, leaving it as pure as a mountain stream; deflecting an oil-tanker from its course at very low speeds presents a problem. A rotating cylinder, fitted into a tanker’s rudder, transforms it from a lumbering vessel into one that is as manoeuvrable as a minnow.
results.description: Cinemagazine items: Farmers cannot often make hay while the sun shines, and the hayfields themselves can often become junior jungles - new machinery has the answer to this problem; anthracite coal is converted into “active carbon” whose particles have a vast porous surface - they literally “hang on” to any impurities in water, leaving it as pure as a mountain stream; deflecting an oil-tanker from its course at very low speeds presents a problem. A rotating cylinder, fitted into a tanker’s rudder, transforms it from a lumbering vessel into one that is as manoeuvrable as a minnow.

results.title: Building synergy
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines the co-operative action in Victoria between schools and the community for use of facilities such as halls, libraries and theatres. Schools designed with community use in mind are working very successfully, with co-ordination of facilities between school and community. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 284 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mirror of Germany. The German Scene = Deutschland Spiegel”.
Magazine items: The “Thunderflashes” is the name of a pop band from a village in Germany which has made the national music scene; the Federal Mail Department is the largest services enterprise in Europe; Schloss Ludwigsburg in one of the finest old baroque castles in Germany; Due to violent labour disputes, many places were without newspapers for several days; the harp-maker Maximilian Horngacher is a master craftsman and constructs 14 to 16 harps each year. The Deutsches Museum in a unique depot for some of the masterpieces of science and technology and the soccer match of Brazil against present world holders Germany, showed the poor performance by the Germans and the brilliance of the Brazillians.
results.description:

The Deutsches Museum in a unique depot for some of the masterpieces of science and technology and the soccer match of Brazil against present world holders Germany, showed the poor performance by the Germans and the brilliance of the Brazillians.
